summary.p: This is the second volume, after Indien 474, of the Tēmpāvaṇi copy owned by Édouard Ariel. The organization of this volume differs from the second volume of the 1851-53 editio princeps of the Tēmpāvaṇi insofar as it includes an additional canto (kuḻavikaḷvataippaṭalam), which, in the printed editon, appears in the third volume.
The manuscript contains the following sections, marked by left-marginal intertitles:

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank.

supportDesc.foliation: Each folio in the text is marked with a Tamil number on the left margin of the the recto, by the original scribe, and with a later Arabic numeration in pencil in the right margin. The scribe begun each canto on a new side of the folio, so we usually have a smaller number of lines in the folios containing the end of a canto.
supportDesc.condition: The manuscript is in fair conditions, with a few holes by woodworms and some humidity on the upper and lower margins of the folios.

additions.desc: Left-marginal chapter (paṭalam titles. See list in the summary, above, and selection below. In-text preview of next chapter.
The ms. contains several ink annotations.

Often, the number of a canto is written in ink next to its title (as in f10r, rm, for instance). We also find the following notes:
Le 19 mai 1841 (f187r, rm)
Le 27 mai 1841 (f197r, rm)
Itil reṇṭu pāṭṭum iraṇṭuraiyum cērntiruk=kutu ("two verses and two commentaries have been added in this [place]" (f203r, rm).
Le 3 juin 1841 (f209r, rm)
These dates seem to mark the point in the text where a reader stopped reading. In the case of the Tamil note, the reader was clearly comparing this manuscript with another version of the text that either he had in mind, or in front of him (as, for instance, in another manuscript copy). Who was this reader? It could not have been Ariel, who was not yet in India in 1841 (he arrived in 1844). If, as it seems to me, the French and Tamil annotations are written in the same hand and with the same ink, he might have some bilingual Catholic scholar from Pondicherry.
BAM: Des numéros tracés à l'encre dans la marge gauche séparent douze parties à la suite des précédentes : f. 1-9, f. 10-43, f. 44-85, f. 86-98, f. 99-109, f. 110-122, f. 123-132, f. 133-168, f. 169-177, f. 178-186, f. 187-221, f. 222-267. Trois feuillets sont datés à l'encre dans la marge droite : f. 187 : 19 mai 1841; f. 197 : 27 mai 1841; f. 209 : 9 juin 1841.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not dated by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) nor by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequested in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868). See date 1841 on some folios.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
